item.title: Deep in the Workshop
item.description: Spent the afternoon taking apart an old mechanism. There is something meditative about understanding how things click together — and the quiet satisfaction when they do again.

item.title: First Adventure
item.description: Kicked off the first entry — a rough-around-the-edges start, but every good log has to begin somewhere. The CMS is live and the words are flowing.

item.title: Building My Homelab from Scratch
item.description: Started with a spare ThinkPad and a dream. Six months later I am running 14 containers, a reverse proxy, and a UPS that has already saved me twice. Here is the full parts list and what I would do differently.

item.title: Docker Compose Patterns I Keep Coming Back To
item.description: After writing hundreds of compose files, a handful of patterns have become muscle memory — named volumes over bind mounts for databases, always pinning image tags, and the restart policy nobody puts in their first file.

item.title: Reverse Proxy 101: Caddy vs Nginx vs Traefik
item.description: Ran all three in production over the past year. Caddy wins on simplicity and auto-HTTPS, Traefik wins for dynamic Docker routing, and Nginx wins when you need to search the error and actually find an answer.

item.title: My Monitoring Stack: Prometheus, Grafana, and Sanity
item.description: Setting up Prometheus and Grafana felt like overkill for a homelab until the day my NAS ran out of disk at 3am and I did not know until morning. Now every service I run has a dashboard. Sleep quality improved.

item.title: Self-Hosting Gitea: Two Years In
item.description: Two years of running my own Gitea instance instead of pushing everything to GitHub. The migration took an afternoon. The maintenance is basically zero. And having a private mirror of every repo I care about is the kind of peace of mind that’s hard to put a price on.
